summary: This is an email chain forwarding Amazon's response to a law enforcement request for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell. The request is part of the criminal investigation (CRIM1048721) and is dated January 31, 2020. The document shows the FBI seeking records from Amazon as part of the Maxwell investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The document is an email chain regarding a law enforcement request for Amazon records related to her, referenced by case number CRIM1048721 2020 DS.

persons.name: Maurene Comey
persons.context: Appears as a recipient (USANYS) of the forwarded email from the FBI regarding the Amazon records request for the Maxwell investigation.

connections.description: Comey is a prosecutor involved in the investigation of Maxwell, as evidenced by being copied on the FBI's email regarding Amazon records for the case.

events.title: Amazon responds to law enforcement request
events.description: Amazon sends its response to an FBI request for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell, referencing case number CRIM1048721.

events.title: FBI forwards Amazon response
events.description: An FBI agent forwards Amazon's response to prosecutors including Maurene Comey regarding the Maxwell investigation.

events.title: Email chain forwarded
events.description: The email chain regarding the Amazon records request is forwarded again, indicating ongoing case activity.

keyFacts: The FBI made a law enforcement request to Amazon for records related to Ghislaine Maxwell under case number CRIM1048721.
Amazon complied with the request but redacted titles of 'expressive materials' and noted the request was voluminous and potentially burdensome.
The email chain shows coordination between the FBI and the U.S. Attorney's Office (specifically prosecutor Maurene Comey) in the Maxwell investigation.
The document references External Case No. 2018R01618, indicating the investigation into Maxwell began in or before 2018.
